description: The code creates a custom HostnameVerifier that blindly returns true, which effectively disables the SSL/TLS certificate validation. This can expose the application to man-in-the-middle attacks and other security threats.
recommendation: Proper certificate validation should be implemented in the verify method to ensure the SSL/TLS connection is secure. Consider using standard HostnameVerifier implementations provided by the Java platform, or implement custom validation logic following best practices for SSL/TLS certificate validation.
